publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2227# Dennis Canavan: Response to the Atrocities in the United States-That the Parliament unequivocally condemns the recent atrocities in the United States of America; calls for effective measures to be taken to bring to justice those responsible for such a mass destruction of human life, and believes that the response of the US Government and the international community must be based not on mindless vengeance or retaliation but on the rule of international law and respect for human rights, particularly innocent people's right to life. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2227# Response to the Atrocities in the United States (lodged on 18 September 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-2227# Dennis Canavan: Response to the Atrocities in the United States-That the Parliament unequivocally condemns the recent atrocities in the United States of America; calls for effective measures to be taken to bring to justice those responsible for such a mass destruction of human life, and believes that the response of the US Government and the international community must be based not on mindless vengeance or retaliation but on the rule of international law and respect for human rights, particularly innocent people's right to life. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2227# Response to the Atrocities in the United States (lodged on 18 September 2001) Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*
S1M-2227# Response to the Atrocities in the United States (lodged on 18 September 2001) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-2227# Dennis Canavan: Response to the Atrocities in the United States-That the Parliament unequivocally condemns the recent atrocities in the United States of America; calls for effective measures to be taken to bring to justice those responsible for such a mass destruction of human life, and believes that the response of the US Government and the international community must be based not on mindless vengeance or retaliation but on the rule of international law and respect for human rights, particularly innocent people's right to life. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Ms Sandra White, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-2227# Response to the Atrocities in the United States (lodged on 18 September 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2227# Response to the Atrocities in the United States (lodged on 18 September 2001) Brian Adam*
